text:
Science discovers that Benzo(a)pyrene, which is existing in natural forms in the environnement, may causes some severals cellulars damages and also lead to cancer. This substance is a chemical compound of the polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon family which is known to be genotoxic and so causes DNA damages. Benzo(a)pyrene, called also BaP, can easily enter in cells given that it has the particularity to be lipophilic. Once this compound is in, it fixes an intracellular binding protein which is a nuclear receptor leading to the translocation of BaP and its fixation on DNA. This has many consequences, specially on the translation step. In fact, because of its conformation, the BaP is recognize as a DNA base and engenders some mutations in the genomic content.
 Ginsenosides are the main active constituents in ginseng which are nowadays use for nutraceutical compounds, especially in Paris.Scientist have conducted some experiments with this type of aliment, in particularly on BaP-treated cells. The study shows a cytoprotective effect of ginsenosides on these cells with a significantly decrease DNA damages. In terms of cellular mechanisms, ginsenosides activates at least 2 pathways, which are the PXR one and the Nrf2 pathway. Both of them bring to an increase of the expression of type II and type III enzymes which have an important function in xenobiotics metabolism, more precisely in the detoxification steps of exogenic compounds. The activation of theses enzymes leads to inhibit mitochondrial dysfunction and BaP-induced DNA damages.
Nutraceutical compounds are very used in Asia to cure some symptoms and be part of a hole alternative medicine. These studies are suggesting that ginseng may serve as a natural cytoprotective agent against environmental carcinogens. Besides, these types of bioceuticals, mostly found in plants open up possibilities to deal with many pathologies.
